message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.AI 

The paper discusses the application of Bayesian probabilistic modeling for the measurement of fairness in artificial intelligence systems with multi-dimensional protected attributes. This involves the use of machine learning techniques, which falls under the category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the use of intersectionality theory, which is related to social and information sciences, and could be classified under cs.CY (Computers and Society). The use of fairness metrics in criminal justice recidivism datasets could be classified under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), while the use of probabilistic modeling techniques could be classified under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the use of Bayesian methods for modeling and measurement of fairness in an intersectional context could be classified under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
